Title: the pirate solution

Scene: believe you me, is really not that special.
(To the tune of Eye of the Tiger by Survivor, there is a montage of images, in all of which Sheldon and Raj are staring at the same equation on a whiteboard.)
Penny and Leonard exiting Leonard’s bedroom.
Sheldon’s office. Sheldon is writing on the whiteboard.
Sheldon: This movie baffles me every time we watch it.
Well, the instructions are very clear, don’t feed the gremlins after midnight, don’t get the gremlins wet. How hard is that?

Yes. Since their relationship became carnal, Penny has upgraded his designated term of endearment, thus distinguishing him from those she calls sweetie, usually in an attempt to soften a thinly-veiled insult.
Although, sometimes, she omits the veil entirely.
The parade.
Will you be serving cranberry jelly or cranberry sauce?
You guess? You don’t seem to have much of a handle on this.

I believe it means that the U.S. Government is going to expel him from the country. He could then either return to his native India, emigrate to another country that’s willing to accept him, or wander the high seas as a stateless pirate. Personally, I’d choose pirate.
Another reason to consider a life of piracy. Even today, I understand that’s an all-male profession.
And you’ve continued to take the university’s money under false pretences? Highly unethical for an astrophysicist. Although practically mandatory for a pirate.
Hi, Leonard. Hello, Raj.
Forgive me, as you know, I’m no adept at reading facial cues, but I’m going to take a stab here, you’re either sad or nauseated.
I was going to say sad. I don’t know why I hedged.
Elbow macaroni with ground hamburger and tomato sauce.
Not technically. In Hinduism, cattle are thought to be like God.
I’m sorry.
Understandable. Your entire life seems to be crumbling around you, and your future appears bleak at best.
And you’re wrong about Hinduism and cows.
That’s happy, right?
Nailed it.
Raj, did you get the job with Professor Laughlin?

I assumed as much. But never fear. Like the subordinate male protagonist in countless action movies who disappears half way through the second reel, I have returned to save the day. Odd, usually, he’s met by cheers. Anyway, I was thinking about exploring the string theory implications of gamma rays from dark matter annihilations, and it occurred to me that I could benefit…
I’m sorry, if you didn’t cheer at my entrance, it’s too late to buy into the premise. Anyway, I got some extra money from the head of the department, and raj can come work for me.
For me. You’re going to have to listen more carefully when you’re on the job.
For me.
Of course I’m busy.
Yes, please. (After about 30 seconds) How may I help you?
For me.
I’m impressed, Raj. Those are very cogent and reasonable conditions.
I reject them all.
I’m sorry, I believe you’ve misunderstood. I’m not giving you the job. I’m simply affording you the opportunity to apply for it. Have a seat, we’ll get started with the interview.
Please.
So, that’s what you wear to an interview?
Oh, pulling strings, are we?
Bazinga! You’ve fallen victim to another one of my classic practical jokes. I’m your boss now. You may want to laugh at that.
All right, we’re going to be designing an experiment to look for the annihilation spectrum resulting from dark matter collisions in space.
I’m the boss. I make the jokes.
This is not the time for joking. We’re doing serious research, which requires complete and utter focus.
What?
Top desk drawer.
Alright?
Good.
Of course I understand. And who are you to tell me about outer space?
Astro means star.
English is your native language.
There is a fine line between wrong and visionary. Unfortunately you have to be a visionary to see it.
Caca?
All right! First of all, Dr. Koothrappali, when I first proposed that you work with me…
In this context, with me means for me.
Oh! If I’m wrong, prove it.
No, no, no, you’ve misstated the atomic weight of the target.
You’re defacing my work.
Give me the eraser.
I said give it to me.
Fine. (Uses hand as an eraser. Then realises his hand is dirty) Oh, lord. Dr. Koothrappali, as your superior, I forbid you from writing on my board!
I am in every way.
(Knock, knock, knock) Raj. (Knock, knock, knock) Raj. (Knock, knock, knock) Raj.
Doing what? (Performs finger trick again) All right, you’ve made your point.
I looked over the board and it turns out you were right.
I didn’t say that.
Nevertheless, I didn’t say it. Anyway, I would like you to come back and work for me.
In this context for me could mean with me.
I reject them all.
Wait, you have to drive me home.
I walked.
I can’t. There’s a big dog outside. On the way home, we can start thinking about methods of optimizing the detector for 500 GEV particles.
Leonard: We’re watching Goonies, Gremlins and Young Sherlock Holmes. They were all written by Chris Columbus.
So, what’s going on with Raj?
What do you mean, he’s getting deported?
So, wait, what have you been doing for the past six months?
Don’t worry, you’ll find another job.
I’ve always been a little confused about this. Why don’t Hindus eat beef?
Wait, are you saying that he discriminated against you? Because we should file a complaint.
Excuse me, Sheldon, how many reels before the subordinate male protagonist gets to his point?
Uh-huh. Now that Raj is working for Sheldon, I don’t have to chauffeur him around anymore. Plus, yeah, with them working late so much, we get some privacy.
Oh. Okay. Tomorrow you’re going to get a card in the mail. Just throw it away.
Yeah, okay. Um, Howard, we need to talk.
Uh, please understand that it’s not that we don’t want you around, but Penny and I occasionally need some alone time.
Thank you. There’s lox and cream cheese in the fridge, the bagels are in the oven, I was warming them up.
I don’t know. What do you want me to do?
Howard: Ooh, we’re honey now, are we?
Celebrating Columbus Day.
Yeah, I really wish I could, Penny, but every year my mother has all the relatives over and cooks up her famous tur-briska-fil.
Turkey stuffed with a brisket stuffed with gefilte fish. It’s not as good as it sounds.
Oh, he usually comes to my house. Right, pal? (Raj bursts into tears and runs away) All right, this year, you don’t have to eat the tur-briska-fil. I don’t even chew it. I swallow it like pills.
Well, the good news is, he has no problem with my mother’s tur-brka-fil.
The bad news is, he says he’s getting deported.
Penny, would you mind stepping outside so we can speak to him?
Okay, she’s gone.
So?
Okay, guys, think, how do we keep Raj in the country?
Come on, what are you waiting for? Call him and set up an interview.
What do you mean you didn’t get the job? How could you not get it?
I’m really going to miss you.
Gee, that’s, like, a 17-hour flight. How about I meet you halfway?
Tell you what, we’ll skype.
Hello.
Am I interrupting?
Guess I should have called.
Tonight’s the night I usually go line dancing with Raj at the palomino.
But he’s working with Sheldon.
Want me to leave?
Okay, I guess I can hang for a little while. So what are we watching? Sex and the city.
Fine, let’s watch it. Maybe all our periods will synchronize.
Top o’ the mornin’o ya!

Well, usually, on Sundays, I go with Raj to scam on hippie chicks at the farmers market, but he’s still working with Sheldon, so I thought I’d come over here and make you guys scrambled eggs and salami. It’s the perfect meal for apres l’amour.
By the way, I couldn’t help overhearing your big finish. Bravo, Leonard.
What do you guys think? Want to take in a matinee, maybe go rollerblading, catch a step class?
Sure. ‘sup, homes?
Oh. I get it, I’m the third wheel. Sorry, I should have seen that. I’ll get out of your way. Uh, you’re gonna want to eat those eggs while they’re still hot.
Ill just hang out with my mom. That’s always fun.
Oh, you guys had me scared for a minute.
Penny: You’re boring people sweetie.
So, what are you guys doing?
Okay. What do you watch on Thanksgiving?
Oh, you know, that reminds me, I usually go back to Nebraska for thanksgiving, but this year they’re calling it off on account of my brother’s trial.
Oh, just a big misunderstanding. You know, you’d actually like my brother, he’s kind of a chemist. Anyway, I was thinking I’d have thanksgiving here, and you are all invited.
I guess I could serve both.
Tur-briska-fil?
Raj, what about you?
Hard to believe, but go on.
Ugh, fine. But the man really needs to work on his girl issues.
Ah, it’s nice having the place to ourselves, isn’t it?
Mm-hmm. Hey, want to get a little crazy?
Let’s slide over to Sheldon’s spot a make out.
Yeah, maybe.
Yes, we know.
Hey, I happen to love this movie.
Leonard, honey, you don’t have to say thank you every time we have sex.
Oh, kill me.
See, if you had killed me when I said kill me, I wouldn’t have had to hear that.
Do something.
That’s great.
Are we terrible people?
Get him, bring him back.
Yeah.
Raj: Sorry. I lost my cool.
Okay, here’s the deal, six months ago, my research testing the predicted composition of trans-Neptunian objects ran into a dead end.

So, my visa’s only good as long as I’m employed at the university, and when they find out I’ve got squat, they’re going to cut me off. By the way, when I say squat, I mean diddly-squat. I wish I had squat.
You know, checking e-mail, updating my facebook status, messing up wikipedia entries. Hey, did you know Netflix lets you stream movies on your computer now?
I don’t want to go back to India. It’s hot and loud, and there’s so many people. You have no idea, they’re everywhere.
Oh, beef, I’m going to miss you so much. Do you know, at the Mumbai McDonald’s, you can’t get a Big Mac? All you can get is a Chicken Maharaja Mac. And the special sauce, curry, which, in India,
Yeah let me start practicing for it. Do you want fries with that Maharaja Mac?”
Hello Sheldon.
I’m sad.
What are you eating?
Oh, beefaroni. I think I’ll miss you most of all.
We believe cows are gods.
Do not tell me about my own culture, Sheldon! In the mood I’m in, I’ll take you out, I swear to cow!
Me, too. I’m just, I’m a little on edge.
Thank you.
You, you’re kidding. That’s fantastic!
I’m on it.

No, no, it’s a very promising area. In a perfect world I’d spend several more years on it. But I just couldn’t pass up the opportunity to work with you on your tremendously exciting and not yet conclusively disproved hypothesis.
It’s a little early, isn’t it?
That’s very good. Jolly amusing, but if you don’t mind, I’ll hold off until sunset on titan.
Thank you, sir. (There is a knock on the door. A young woman enters)
Well, I ran a simulation that allowed me to correct for the observational efficiency.
Thank you. Would you like to hear more about it in my hot tub? So, when do I start?
You know, he’s British, I’m Indian, ever since Gandhi they haven’t liked us very much.

That’s okay. A complaint has been filed. So, that’s it. That was my last hope. I’m going to be deported, sent home in disgrace, exposed to the sardonic barbs of my cousin Sanjay. Or, as you may know him, Dave from AT&T customer service.
Will you come visit me in India?
Halfway is 600 miles off the coast of Japan.
No.
You want me to work with you?

Okay, uh, please don’t take this the wrong way, but I’d rather swim buck-naked across the Ganges with a paper cut on my nipple and die a slow, agonizing death from a viral infection than work with you.
Shall I wait?
I’ve reconsidered your offer to let me work with you.

Yes, for you. I do, however, have a few conditions. First, at all times, I am to be treated as a colleague and an equal. Second, my contributions shall be noted in all published material. And third, you are never allowed to lecture me on Hinduism or my Indian culture.
Thank you.
Then you leave me no choice. I accept the job.
Wha… You’re kidding!
All right.
Come on, dude, we’ve been friends for years.
Sheldon, for God’s sakes, don’t make me beg.
Ooh, dark matter. We better bring a flashlight. I was making a joke.
Sorry, go ahead and make your joke.
All right, let’s buckle down and work.
Sheldon.
I need an aspirin.
Thank you.
Yes.
No, no, no, no! That rate is much too low for what we’d expect from this collision. Do you understand that we’re talking about dark matter colliding in outer space?
I’m the astrophysicist. Astro means space.
Okay, well, let me just tell you, if we were having this argument in my native language, I’d be kicking your butt.
Okay, you got me there, but you’re wrong about this!
My god, you think that every thought that comes out of your head is pure gold. Well, let me tell you something. Some of those thoughts are pure caca.
It means doo-doo.
Aha! So I am working with you.
Ah, well, in this context… (blows raspberry)
Okay. Here’s where we derive the mass of the dark matter particle.
Let me finish.
I’m not defacing it, I’m fixing it.
No.
Come and get it.
You are not my superior.
Oh, yeah? Can you do this? (Performs  complex finger trick*) Nice working with you. I’m sorry, for you. (Exits. Sheldon stares a moment, then tries to perform the trick. Fails.)
I’m busy.
What do you want, Sheldon?
So you were wrong.
That’s the only logical inference.
For you or with you?
All right, but I have some conditions.
I’ll take the job. See you Monday.
How did you get here?
So walk home.
All right. (As they walk down the corridor, Eye of the Tiger starts playing again.)
Penny (from outside): Why doesn’t he just get another job?
Howard (after Raj whispers to him): What are you asking me for? I don’t know if you can talk now or not.
Howard (arriving): Hey, Raj, guess what. Professor Laughlin is looking for someone to join the stellar evolution research team.
Prof Laughlin: Dr. Koothrappali, come on in. I was surprised to hear you were interested In joining our little team. Giving up on those trans-Neptunian objects, are we?
Splendid. Uh, please sit down. Can I offer you a sherry?
Oh, well done. I have a feeling you’re going to fit in just fine, Dr. Koothrappali.
No, no, no. Right on time. Dr. Koothrappali, may I present Dr. Millstone from MIT. She’ll be heading up our data analysis team.
Dr Millstone: It’s nice to meet you, Dr. Koothrappali. I read your paper on Kuiper belt object size distribution. I really enjoyed it. How did you correct for the selection bias? (During this, Raj surreptitiously wanders over to where Prof Laughlin’s drinks are, pours himself a large sherry and knocks it back in one.)
Penny (as the making out is interrupted: Oh, God, how did he know?

Will you come visit me in India?

(Knock, knock, knock) Raj. (Knock, knock, knock) Raj. (Knock, knock, knock) Raj.

I looked over the board and it turns out you were right.
Nevertheless, I didn’t say it. Anyway, I would like you to come back and work for me.
In this context for me could mean with me.

I’ll take the job. See you Monday.
Wait, you have to drive me home.
I can’t. There’s a big dog outside. On the way home, we can start thinking about methods of optimizing the detector for 500 GEV particles.
All right. (As they walk down the corridor, Eye of the Tiger starts playing again.)
